Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Amakusa, could you turn that off?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Amakusa, could you turn that off?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「天草、それ切ってくれる？」
Russian (RU): "Амакуса, сделай одолжение, выключи, а?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Amakusa, poderia desligar isso?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「天草，能把它關了嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「天草，能把它关了吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Amakusa, puoi spegnerla?"

Speaker: Amakusa Juuza
Steam (ST): "Whoops, my bad. You don't like M. Zakky?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Whoops, my bad. You don't like {nobr:M. Zakky}?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「おっと、そりゃ失礼。Ｍ・ザッキーはお嫌いで？」
Russian (RU): "Ой‐ой, пардон, виноват. Вам не нравится {nobr:М. Закки}?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Opa, eu peço desculpas. Não gosta do {nobr:M. Zakky}?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哦，抱歉。您討厭 {c:86EF9C:M.Zakky}？{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書同名條目）}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哦，抱歉。您讨厌 {c:86EF9C:M.Zakky}？{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书同名条目）}」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Whoops, scusa. Non ti piace M. Zakky?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "I'm just not in the mood."
Umineko Project (UP): "I'm just not in the mood."
PC Japanese (JP): 「今が気分じゃないだけ。」
Russian (RU): "Просто я не в настроении."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Só não estou no clima."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「只是這會兒沒心情罷了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「只是这会儿没心情罢了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non sono dell'umore adatto."

Steam (ST): Amakusa turned the radio off.
Umineko Project (UP): Amakusa turned the radio off.
PC Japanese (JP): 天草がラジオを切る。
Russian (RU): Амакуса выключил радио.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Amakusa desligou o rádio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 天草關掉了收音機。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 天草关掉了收音机。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Amakusa spense la radio.

Steam (ST): The world of cheery sounds was immediately swallowed up by the roar of the sea... and blotted out by the ocean's gray...
Umineko Project (UP): The world of cheery sounds was immediately swallowed up by the roar of the sea, and blotted out by the ocean's gray......
PC Japanese (JP): 陽気な音の世界はたちまち潮騒に飲み込まれ、海の灰色で塗り潰してしまった……。
Russian (RU): Мир весёлых звуков тут же поглотил шум моря, а океан закрасил его своей серостью...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O mundo repleto de sons joviais imediatamente foi engolido pelo rugido do mar, tingido pelo cinza do oceano......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 輕快之音的世界立即被波濤聲吞沒，被大海的灰色所掩蓋……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 轻快之音的世界立即被波涛声吞没，被大海的灰色所掩盖……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il mondo di suoni allegri fu immediatamente inghiottito dal ruggito del mare, e cancellato dal grigio dell'oceano...

Speaker: Captain Kawabata
Steam (ST): "......Can you see it? Over there's where the harbor was at the time."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........See it? Over there's where the harbor was at the time."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………見えるかい。あの辺が当時の船着場だ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………見えるかい。あの辺が当時の船着場だ」
Russian (RU): ".........Ты видишь? Там, где тогда была гавань."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Consegue ver? Lá é onde ficava o porto."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………看得到不？那邊就是當時的碼頭。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………看得到不？那边就是当时的码头。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Riesce a vederlo? Lì è dove al tempo c'era il molo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Traditional (CHT): [=JPC]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=JPC]

Steam (ST): The boat captain pointed, but I couldn't really recall that scene of 12 years ago.
Umineko Project (UP): The boat captain pointed, but I couldn't really recall how it looked twelve years ago.
PC Japanese (JP): 船長が指差すが、１２年も前の光景は、なかなか蘇らない。
Russian (RU): Капитан катера указал мне, но я никак не могла вспомнить сцену двенадцатилетней давности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O capitão do barco apontou, mas eu não consegui lembrar muito bem como ele se parecia doze anos atrás.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然船長在指給我看，但十二年前的情景就是浮現不起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然船长在指给我看，但十二年前的情景就是浮现不起来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il capitano della barca indicò, ma non riuscii davvero a ricordare quella scena di 12 anni fa.

Steam (ST): ...I thought I'd surely be able to immediately remember how things had been at the time, ...but no memories came back to me.
Umineko Project (UP): ......I had believed that my memories of back then would come flooding back into my mind, ...but no memories were coming back to me at all.
PC Japanese (JP): ……てっきり、こういうものは見る見る溢れるように当時のことを思い出せるに違いないと信じていたが、…一向に当時の記憶は戻らない。
Russian (RU): ......Я полагала, что, несомненно, смогу сразу вспомнить, как всё было тогда, но воспоминания пока так и не вернулись ко мне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu pensei que minhas memórias voltariam inundando minha mente, ...mas nenhuma memória está voltando para mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我本以為，越是看這些東西，當時的事一定越能如潮水般涌入腦海，…但此刻，當時的記憶卻一點都沒回來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我本以为，越是看这些东西，当时的事一定越能如潮水般涌入脑海，…但此刻，当时的记忆却一点都没回来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Avevo creduto che sarei stata sicuramente capace di ricordare subito come le cose erano al tempo... ma non mi è tornato alcun ricordo.

Steam (ST): After that incident, the island was sealed off and left to the wild.
Umineko Project (UP): After the incident, the island was sealed off and left to the wild.
PC Japanese (JP): あの事件以来、島は封印され荒れるに任されている。
Russian (RU): После того инцидента остров оказался закрытой местностью и одичал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois do incidente, a ilha foi selada e deixada à ruína.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 自那起事件以來，島被封印、荒廢了十多年。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 自那起事件以来，岛被封印、荒废了十多年。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopo quell'incidente, l'isola fu isolata e lasciata inselvatichire.

Steam (ST): ...I couldn't satisfy myself with the thought that this was just inevitable, and it felt sad and painful for some reason.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Probably that's understandable, I had to tell myself, to stop myself from feeling somehow...sad and hurt.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それも無理からぬことだろうと、自分を納得させないと、…なぜか悲しくて辛かった。
Russian (RU): ......Такого, впрочем, вполне следовало ожидать, но от этой неудачи на душе у меня почему‐то стало горько и больно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu não consegui satisfazer a mim mesma de que isso era inevitável...e, por algum motivo, me senti triste e deprimida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……若是不對自己說“這也是沒辦法的事”，…就會不禁悲從中來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……若是不对自己说“这也是没办法的事”，…就会不禁悲从中来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Anche questo è piuttosto logico, ma incapace di soddisfarmi... per qualche ragione fu triste e doloroso.

Steam (ST): ......Ah, but I at least remember one thing.
Umineko Project (UP): .........Ah, but I at least remember one thing.
PC Japanese (JP): ………あぁ、でも、これだけは覚えてる。
Russian (RU): .........Ах, но, по‐крайней мере, я помнила одну вещь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Ah, mas ao menos de uma coisa eu lembro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………啊——，不過，有樣東西還記得。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………啊——，不过，有样东西还记得。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ah, ma almeno ricordo una cosa.

Steam (ST): You might say that it'd probably be the same anywhere on the sea, ...but I remember at least one thing.
Umineko Project (UP): You could say that it would probably be the same anywhere on the sea, ......but at least this one thing, I do remember.
PC Japanese (JP): 海ならどこでも同じだろうと言われればそれまでだが、……これだけは覚えてる。
Russian (RU): Такие звуки, наверное, можно услышать где угодно на море, но эта деталь врезалась мне в память.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Você poderia dizer que isto é igual em qualquer parte do mar, ......ao menos lembro disso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖說在海上的任何地方，這都是一樣的，……但這個我還記得。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽说在海上的任何地方，这都是一样的，……但这个我还记得。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si potrebbe dire che probabilmente è uguale in ogni parte del mare... ma ricordo almeno una cosa.

Steam (ST): The cries... of the seagulls. I do remember...those.
Umineko Project (UP): The cries...of the seagulls. I do remember those.
PC Japanese (JP): うみねこの、鳴き声。これだけは、覚えている。
Russian (RU): Крики... чаек. Я помню... их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O choro...das gaivotas. Eu lembro dele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 海貓的，鳴叫聲。僅此一樣，還記得。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 海猫的，鸣叫声。仅此一样，还记得。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il verso... dei gabbiani. Me lo ricordo... quello.

Steam (ST): ...When I was young, I rarely went to the ocean.
Umineko Project (UP): ......I almost never went to the ocean when I was young.
PC Japanese (JP): ……幼かった私にとって、海は滅多に行かない場所。
Russian (RU): ......Когда я была маленькой, мне редко доводилось плавать по океану.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu quase nunca fui à praia quando era criança.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對幼年時的我來說，大海是極少有機會去的地方。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对幼年时的我来说，大海是极少有机会去的地方。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Quando ero piccola, raramente andavo verso l'oceano.

Steam (ST): ...So everything that symbolized the ocean meant Rokkenjima and a family gathering to me.
Umineko Project (UP): ...So, to me, everything that symbolized the ocean meant Rokkenjima, and my family getting together.
PC Japanese (JP): …だから、海にかかわる記号の全ては、六軒島と親族の集まりを意味した。
Russian (RU): Поэтому всем, с чем у меня ассоциировался океан, были Роккенджима и семейное собрание.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Por isso, para mim, tudo que simboliza o oceano era Rokkenjima, e minha família se reunindo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …所以，與海有關的所有記號，全都意味著六軒島、親戚聚會。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …所以，与海有关的所有记号，全都意味着六轩岛、亲戚聚会。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Quindi ogni cosa che simboleggiava l'oceano per me significava Rokkenjima e la riunione della famiglia.

Steam (ST): In short, ...it was a symbol for the happiness of going out with my family.
Umineko Project (UP): In short, ......it was a symbol for the happiness of going out with my family.
PC Japanese (JP): 早い話が、……家族でお出掛けという幸せの記号だったわけだ。
Russian (RU): В общем, он являлся символом счастливого времени, проводимого с моей семьёй.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Resumindo, ......sair com a minha família simbolizava a felicidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 簡單來講，……它們就是代表著一家人出門玩的，幸福的記號。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 简单来讲，……它们就是代表着一家人出门玩的，幸福的记号。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In breve... era il simbolo della felicità di uscire con la mia famiglia.

Steam (ST): However, at this point in time, it seems doubtful whether that even was happiness.
Umineko Project (UP): However, at this point in time, it even seems doubtful whether that was happiness at all.
PC Japanese (JP): もっとも、今となっては、その幸せ、というのも疑わしい。
Russian (RU): Однако теперь я начинаю сомневаться, а было ли то время счастьем.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Antigamente, e até hoje, essa felicidade parece duvidosa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過說到底，到了現在，就連這幸福都顯得挺可疑的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过说到底，到了现在，就连这幸福都显得挺可疑的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, a questo punto, sembra persino messo incerto se quella fosse felicità.

Steam (ST): In my younger days, the trip had felt like a relaxed family vacation, but considering my parents' situation at the time, it was surely a very difficult trip to handle, with the distribution of the inheritance filling the place with the smell of gunpowder.
Umineko Project (UP): In my younger days, the trip had felt like a relaxed family vacation, but considering my parents' situation at the time, it was surely a very difficult trip to handle, with the distribution of the inheritance filling the place with the smell of flaring tempers and fuses about to blow.
PC Japanese (JP): 幼い私には気楽な家族旅行気分だったが、両親たちの当時の都合から想像するならば、遺産分配で火薬の臭いが立ち込める、さぞや世知辛い旅行だったに違いない。
Russian (RU): В дни, когда я была гораздо моложе, такая поездка воспринималась мною как отдых вместе с семьёй, однако теперь, принимая во внимание ситуацию, с которой приходилось иметь дело моим родителям, я понимаю, каким испытанием это было для них, сидящих на пороховой бочке под названием делёжка наследства.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na minha infância, a viagem era algo como férias para a família descansar, mas considerando a situação dos meus pais na época, era realmente uma viagem muito difícil de se fazer, com o assunto da distribuição da herança preenchendo o lugar, com o cheiro de ânimos acirrados como pólvora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然幼小的我無憂無慮地把這當成了家庭旅行，但從當時雙親的近況上來想，這想必是趟因遺產分配一事而充滿了火藥味的艱辛之旅吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然幼小的我无忧无虑地把这当成了家庭旅行，但从当时双亲的近况上来想，这想必是趟因遗产分配一事而充满了火药味的艰辛之旅吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nella mia giovinezza, il viaggio sembrava come una vacanza di famiglia, ma considerando la situazione dei miei genitori al tempo, di certo era un viaggio molto difficile da gestire, con la distribuzione dell'eredità che riempiva il posto con l'odore della polvere da sparo.

Steam (ST): I can remember giggling all over the place, completely ignorant of my parents' feelings...
Umineko Project (UP): I can remember giggling all over the place, completely ignorant of my parents' feelings...
PC Japanese (JP): 親の気持ちなど知りもせず、きゃっきゃと浮かれていた当時を、思い出す…。
Russian (RU): Я помню, как всюду хихикала, совершенно не понимая их положения и чувств.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu consigo me lembrar de ficar rindo por todos os cantos, completamente ignorante dos sentimentos dos meus pais...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我想起了自己當時不知父母心事，瞎高興的情景…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我想起了自己当时不知父母心事，瞎高兴的情景…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Riesco a ricordami che andavo in giro ridacchiando, ignorando completamente i sentimenti dei miei genitori...

Speaker: Amakusa Juuza
Steam (ST): "...Rokkenjima, huh? The place of all beginnings, and the end of the line for all journeys."
Umineko Project (UP): "Rokkenjima, ......is it. The beginning of everything, and the last stop for all journeys."
PC Japanese (JP): 「六軒島、……ですかい。全ての始まりで、全ての旅の終着駅ってわけだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「六軒島、……ですかい。全ての始まりで、全ての旅の終着駅ってわけだ」
Russian (RU): "Роккенджима, значит... Начало всего и последняя остановка всех путешествий."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Rokkenjima, ......está logo ali. O início de tudo, a última parada de todas as jornadas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「六軒島，……麼？它既是一切的開端，也是一切旅程的終點啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「六轩岛，……么？它既是一切的开端，也是一切旅程的终点啊。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Rokkenjima... eccola. L'inizio di tutto, e l'ultima fermata di tutto il viaggio."

Steam (ST): Amakusa, in an attempt to speak for my innermost feelings, tried to sound cool.
Umineko Project (UP): Amakusa tried too hard in an attempt to speak for my innermost feelings.
PC Japanese (JP): 天草は、私の胸中を代弁したつもりになって、格好付けた言い方をする。
Russian (RU): Амакуса, стремясь выразить мои потаённые чувства, пытался звучать важно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Amakusa se esforçou na tentativa de falar com os meus mais íntimos sentimentos, tentando parecer legal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 天草為代言我的心裡話，故意耍帥地說道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 天草为代言我的心里话，故意耍帅地说道。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Amakusa, in un tentativo di parlare ai miei sentimenti più profondi, provò a sembrare figo.

Steam (ST): The boat slowly rounded the island. ...I hoped that viewing it at a different angle might bring back my memories of the island's silhouette at the time just a little, but in the end, even when that inlet was hidden completely by cliffs, I wasn't able to remember anything...
Umineko Project (UP): The boat slowly rounded the island. ......As the angle changed, I hoped that my memories of the island's silhouette at the time might come back just a little, but in the end, even as the inlet was completely hidden by the cliffs, I wasn't able to remember anything...
PC Japanese (JP): 船はゆっくりと島を回りこんでいく。……角度が変われば、当時の島影の記憶が少しは戻るだろうかと期待したが、結局、その入り江が完全に崖に隠れても、何も思い出すことは出来なかった…。
Russian (RU): Катер медленно обогнул остров. Пока менялся угол обзора, я надеялась, что мои воспоминания о силуэте острова в то время вернутся хотя бы отчасти, но в итоге, хоть небольшой залив и оказался полностью скрыт скалами, я так ничего и не вспомнила.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O barco lentamente deu a volta na ilha. ......Conforme o ângulo mudava, eu esperava que minhas memórias do formato da ilha naquela época voltassem ao menos um pouco, mas no fim, mesmo a enseada estava completamente escondida pelos penhascos, e não fui capaz de lembrar de nada...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 船在慢慢地繞島航行。……雖然我在期待著，換下角度，也許就能稍微找回點對當時島影的記憶，但結果，直到海灣完全被峭壁擋住了，也還是什麼都沒能想起來…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 船在慢慢地绕岛航行。……虽然我在期待着，换下角度，也许就能稍微找回点对当时岛影的记忆，但结果，直到海湾完全被峭壁挡住了，也还是什么都没能想起来…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La barca circumnavigò l'isola. ... Come cambiava angolo, speravo che i miei ricordi della sagoma dell'isola al tempo potessero riaffiorarmi un poco, ma alla fine, nonostante l'insenatura fosse completamente nascosta dalle scogliere, non fui capace di ricordare niente...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "...Captain, please tell me... about that other harbor you mentioned."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Captain, that thing you mentioned...about the other harbor...please tell me about it."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……船長、さっきの。もう一つの船着場の話を聞かせてください。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……船長、さっきの。もう一つの船着場の話を聞かせてください」
Russian (RU): ".....Капитан, насчёт той вещи, о которой вы упоминали — о другой гавани. Пожалуйста, расскажите о ней поподробней."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Capitão, aquilo que você mencionou...sobre o outro porto...por favor, me fale sobre ele."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……船長。請再說一遍，剛才講的另一個碼頭的事吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……船长。请再说一遍，刚才讲的另一个码头的事吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Capitano, quella cosa che ha nominato... sull'altro molo... per favore me ne parli."

Speaker: Captain Kawabata
Steam (ST): "Sure. ......Rokkenjima supposedly has only one harbor. But that's only for public appearances."
Umineko Project (UP): "Mmhm. .........They say Rokkenjima's only got one harbor. But that's only its outward appearance."
PC Japanese (JP): 「うむ。………六軒島には、船着場は一つしかないことになっとる。だがそれは表向きだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うむ。………六軒島には、船着場は一つしかないことになっとる。だがそれは表向きだ」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ma un giorno, *bang*, tutto quell'andare e venire da e per Kuwadorian improvvisamente si fermò. Fu circa 30 anni fa... quindi all'incirca Showa 43 (1968), credo."

Umineko Project (UP): "Bang? You mean suddenly?"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……食料やゴミなどの運搬往来で、わしらは決められた日程で裏に行っとった。……あぁ、裏っちゅうのは、九羽鳥庵側の船着場のことだ」
Russian (RU): ".....Мы плавали в тыл по расписанию, привозя еду и увозя всякий мусор. .....О, под тылом я имею в виду гавань на стороне Кувадориана."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……为了送食物收垃圾等等的搬运往来，我们会按定好的日程去“后面”。……啊——，这个“后面”，就是指九羽鸟庵方面的码头。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Venivamo dal retro con dei turni precisi per trasportare cibo e rifiuti da una parte o dall'altra. ... Oh, quando dico ‘dal retro’, intendo il molo dalla parte di Kuwadorian."

Umineko Project (UP): "I get it. ...So then?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「明白。…然后呢？」

Umineko Project (UP): "So one day, I get a sudden message from Genji‐san. And he tells me, until you hear differently, we don't need you to go to the back anymore."

Russian (RU): "Как вдруг однажды к нам поступило срочное сообщение от Генджи‐сана. Он сказал, что пока мы не получим иных указаний, нам больше не нужно выполнять рейсы."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「特にはなかった。早い話が、ある日突然、裏には今後、定期便はいらない、食料も届けなくていいと言われたわけだ。……わしは最初、クビにされたのかと思ったよ」
Russian (RU): "Да нет. Короче говоря, однажды меня внезапно уведомили, что от меня больше не требуется совершать регулярные рейсы в тыл острова и отвозить туда еду. ......Поначалу я решил, что меня уволили."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nada em particular. Para resumir a história, um dia, de repente, foi dito que eles não precisavam mais voltar com os serviços regulares, e não precisava mais se preocupar em levar comida. ......Primeiro pensei que havia sido demitido."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「沒來過。簡單來說，就是某天突然跟我說了，今後不用定期開船去“後面”了，食物也不用送了。……我剛開始還以為是被炒了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「没来过。简单来说，就是某天突然跟我说了，今后不用定期开船去“后面”了，食物也不用送了。……我刚开始还以为是被炒了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non in particolare. In breve, un giorno, improvvisamente, mi era stato detto che non avrebbero più avuto bisogno di regolare servizio nella parte del retro, e che non dovevo neanche più portare il cibo. ... All'inizio, pensai di essere stato licenziato.

Russian (RU): "Но я быстро обратил внимание. .....А по реакции слуг, знавших о Кувадориане, я смог более и менее понять, что случилось."

Umineko Project (UP): ".........{f:5:Beatrice} died, and there was no longer any need to take food or people to care for her?"

Speaker: Captain Kawabata
Steam (ST): "That's what I think. From that point on, I was never told to take a boat to the Hidden Side. However, after that, Genji-san came to see me face to face and got pushy, strongly urging me never to speak of anything related to the Hidden Side until I died."
Umineko Project (UP): "That's what I think. I've never been told to take another boat to the back since. But after that, Genji‐san came to see me face to face, and got real pushy, demanding me to take everything about "the back" with me to the grave."
PC Japanese (JP): 「わしはそう考えとる。それっきり、裏へ船を出せという指示は受けてない。しかし、裏については死ぬまで何も喋るなと、その後、源次さんが直接わしのところへ来て、偉く強く念を押した。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わしはそう考えとる。それっきり、裏へ船を出せという指示は受けてない。しかし、裏については死ぬまで何も喋るなと、その後、源次さんが直接わしのところへ来て、偉く強く念を押した」
Russian (RU): "Вот я так и подумал. После этого меня больше не просили плавать в тыл. Однако потом Генджи‐сан нанёс мне визит с глазу на глаз и крайне настойчиво попросил, чтобы я не разглашал ничего, относящегося к тылу острова, пока я жив."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Foi o que eu pensei. Eu nunca recebi ordens para levar outro barco para lá desde então. Mas depois disso, o Genji‐san veio falar comigo pessoalmente, e foi muito insistente, demandando que eu levasse tudo sobre esse "lado secreto" comigo para o túmulo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我就是這麼想的。自此以後，再也沒接到過開船去“後面”的指示了。不過，在這之後，源次先生有直接來過我這，語氣非常重地叮囑了，到死都別把有關“後面”的任何事說出去。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我就是这么想的。自此以后，再也没接到过开船去“后面”的指示了。不过，在这之后，源次先生有直接来过我这，语气非常重地叮嘱了，到死都别把有关“后面”的任何事说出去。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È quello che penso. Da quel momento in poi, non mi fu più detto di portare la barca sul retro. Tuttavia, dopo ciò, Genji-san venne per vedermi faccia a faccia, e si impose, esortandomi fortemente a non parlare mai di ciò in relazione al retro dell'isola fino alla mia morte."

Umineko Project (UP): "So, if that hidden mansion was abandoned for twenty whole years, .........why was Aunt Eva there?"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então, se a mansão secreta foi abandonada vinte anos atrás, .........por que a tia Eva esteve lá?"

Umineko Project (UP): On that day twelve years ago.........Ushiromiya Eva somehow escaped harm alone in a hidden mansion two kilometers away from the regular mansion.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele dia, doze anos atrás.........De alguma forma, Ushiromiya Eva conseguiu escapar sozinha e ilesa da mansão secreta, cerca de dois quilômetros de distância da mansão normal.

Umineko Project (UP): Why was she in a hidden mansion that had been forgotten for twenty years.........?

Speaker: Captain Kawabata
Steam (ST): "I saw on the talk shows. Even I don't have a clue what happened. Not once did I guide Eva-san to the Hidden Side. I have no idea how or why she knew about or reached Kuwadorian."
Umineko Project (UP): "I saw that on the talk shows. Even I can't make heads or tails of that. Not once did I show Eva‐san to the back. I don't have the first damn clue how she knew about Kuwadorian or how she got there."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ワイドショーで見たよ。わしにも何が何だかさっぱりわからん。絵羽さんを裏へ案内したことは一度もない。どうして、どうやって九羽鳥庵を知り、辿り着いたのか、わしにはさっぱり見当もつかない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ワイドショーで見たよ。わしにも何が何だかさっぱりわからん。絵羽さんを裏へ案内したことは一度もない。どうして、どうやって九羽鳥庵を知り、辿り着いたのか、わしにはさっぱり見当もつかない」
Russian (RU): "Я видел ток‐шоу. Даже я не знаю, что произошло. Я ни разу не возил Еву‐сан в тыл. Поэтому понятия не имею, как и почему она знала о Кувадориане и как добралась до него."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu vi falarem sobre isso em um talk shows. Mesmo eu não faço ideia do motivo. Nunca mostrei a Eva‐san esse lado secreto. Eu não fazia a menor ideia de que ela sabia sobre Kuwadorian e nem como chegou lá."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「有在八卦秀上看到過。不過，我也是一點都不明白。我從未帶繪羽夫人去過“後面”。對於她是怎麼知道，以及怎麼去的九羽鳥庵，我也完全沒有頭緒。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「有在八卦秀上看到过。不过，我也是一点都不明白。我从未带绘羽夫人去过“后面”。对于她是怎么知道，以及怎么去的九羽鸟庵，我也完全没有头绪。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "L'ho visto nei talk show. Anche se non ho la più pallida idea di cosa si successo. Non ho mai guidato neanche una volta Eva-san nel retro. Non ho idea di come o perché fosse venuta a conoscenza e avesse raggiunto Kuwadorian."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "I wonder if it was possible to reach this Hidden Kuwadorian by land."
Umineko Project (UP): "I wonder if it was possible to go to the back where Kuwadorian is by land."

Steam (ST): "...If, as we heard, the forest was dense and uncultivated, I seriously doubt a well-dressed lady person'd be able to bush-crash it."
Umineko Project (UP): "......If, as we heard, the forest was dense and uncultivated, I seriously doubt a well‐dressed lady person'd be able to push through it."

Steam (ST): "Are you kidding? That two-nighter typhoon was awful. No way you could'a used a boat."
Umineko Project (UP): "Are you kidding? That two‐nighter typhoon was awful. No way you could'a used a boat."

Russian (RU): "Да ты что. Тот двухночный тайфун был ужасен. О какой‐нибудь лодке тут и речи быть не может."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você está brincando? O tufão foi horrível durante aquelas duas noites.{n}É impossível ter usado um barco."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哪能呢。那兩晚的台風，那叫一個不得了。船是毫無用武之地的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哪能呢。那两晚的台风，那叫一个不得了。船是毫无用武之地的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sta scherzando? Quel tifone delle due notti fu terribile. Impossibile che possa aver usato una barca."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "So what if...there was an underground passage or something between the mansion and Kuwadorian. Wouldn't it have been a pain to have to charter a boat each time he wanted to visit his mistress's house...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "What if there was......an underground passage or something between the mansion and Kuwadorian. It would have been a pain to have to charter a boat each time he wanted to visit his mistress's house, right...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「じゃあ、屋敷と九羽鳥庵を直通する、……例えば地下通路のようなものがあったとか。愛人の家へ出入りするのに、毎回、船の用立てが必要なんて、面倒でしょう…？」
Russian (RU): "А что если... Что если между особняком и Кувадорианом имелся подземный ход. Ведь было бы крайне неудобно каждый раз плыть на лодке, когда возникало желание нанести своей любовнице визит."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E se......tivesse uma passagem subterrânea ou algo do tipo que conectasse a mansão e a Kuwadorian. Seria complicado ter que chamar um barco toda a vez que ele quisesse visitar a casa da amante, certo...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那，會不會是有直接連通大屋與秘宅的，……比如說，像是地下通道的玩意呢？去情婦家每回都得靠船的話，那就太麻煩了吧…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那，会不会是有直接连通大屋与秘宅的，……比如说，像是地下通道的玩意呢？去情妇家每回都得靠船的话，那就太麻烦了吧…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "E se... ci fosse stato un passaggio sotterraneo o qualcosa tra la villa e Kuwadorian. Non sarebbe stato un fastidio dover noleggiare una barca ogni volta che voleva visitare la dimora della sua amante...?"

Speaker: Amakusa Juuza
Steam (ST): "You mean a tunnel long enough to connect mansions on opposite sides of a 2 kilometer island like Rokkenjima...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "A tunnel long enough to connect mansions on opposite sides of a two‐kilometer island like Rokkenjima...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「全長２ｋｍの六軒島の、対角線上に存在する屋敷を繋ぐために、そんだけの長い地下トンネルを…？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「全長２ｋｍの六軒島の、対角線上に存在する屋敷を繋ぐために、そんだけの長い地下トンネルを…？」
Russian (RU): "То есть туннель достаточно длинный, чтобы соединять два особняка на противоположных концах Роккенджимы на расстоянии в 2 километра?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Um túnel comprido o bastante para conectar duas mansões que estão de lados opostos em uma ilha de dois quilômetros como Rokkenjima...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「為了跟位於這個全長兩公里的六軒島的對角線上的大屋相連，而造了那麼長的地下隧道…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「为了跟位于这个全长两公里的六轩岛的对角线上的大屋相连，而造了那么长的地下隧道…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Intendi un tunnel lungo abbastanza da connettere le due ville dalle parti opposte di un'isola di 2 chilometri come Rokkenjima...?

Speaker: Amakusa Juuza
Steam (ST): "...Well, I'd like to laugh at the thought, but this rich guy made a whole hidden mansion for his mistress. Guess I can't deny the possibility. ...What do you think, Captain?"
Umineko Project (UP): "...Well, I'd like to laugh at the thought, but this is a guy so rich he made a whole hidden mansion for his mistress. Guess I can't deny the possibility. ......What do you think, Captain?"
PC Japanese (JP): …と、馬鹿にしてえところだが、愛人のために隠し屋敷まで作っちまう大富豪だ。それも否定できんところですな。……どうなんですか、船長。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…と、馬鹿にしてえところだが、愛人のために隠し屋敷まで作っちまう大富豪だ。それも否定できんところですな。……どうなんですか、船長」
Russian (RU): "...Ну, я бы обсмеял такую мысль, однако этот богач отгрохал целый тайный особняк для своей любовницы. Так что такую вероятность отрицать нельзя. ......А вы что думаете, Капитан?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Bem, eu queria poder rir disso, mas aquele cara era tão rico que construiu uma mansão inteira só para a amante. Acho que não posso negar essa possibilidade. ......O que você acha, capitão?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…雖然想就這事開玩笑，但畢竟是為了情婦，連秘密宅邸都建了的大富豪啊。這個可能，還真沒法排除。……您覺得怎麼樣，船長？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…虽然想就这事开玩笑，但毕竟是为了情妇，连秘密宅邸都建了的大富豪啊。这个可能，还真没法排除。……您觉得怎么样，船长？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Beh, riderei al solo pensiero, ma questo tipo ricco ha costruito un'intera villa nascosta per la sua amante. Credo di non poter negare questa possibilità. {n}Che ne pensa, Capitano?"

Speaker: Captain Kawabata
Steam (ST): "I'm a man of the sea. I don't know about holes. But the Japanese military dug a 25 kilometer tunnel on Iwo Jima. Wouldn't surprise me if "that" Kinzo-san could dig at least 2 kilometers."
Umineko Project (UP): "I'm a man of the sea. No good asking me about holes. But the Japanese military dug a {i:twenty‐five}‐kilometer tunnel on Iwo Jima. Wouldn't surprise me one bit if {i:the} Kinzo‐san could dig at least two."
PC Japanese (JP): 「わしは海の人間だ。穴のことはわからん。だが、硫黄島で日本軍は２５ｋｍのトンネルを掘ってみせたぞ。あの金蔵さんなら２ｋｍくらい掘ってみせても、わしゃ何も驚かん。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わしは海の人間だ。穴のことはわからん。だが、硫黄島で旧日本軍は２５ｋｍのトンネルを掘ってみせたぞ。あの金蔵さんなら２ｋｍくらい掘ってみせても、わしゃ何も驚かん」
Russian (RU): "Я человек моря. В норах не разбираюсь. Однако японская армия прокопала 25‐километровый туннель на Иво Джиме. Так что я не удивлюсь, если Кинзо‐сан прокопал как минимум 2 км."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu sou um homem do mar. Não sei nada sobre buracos. Mas o exército japonês cavou um túnel de {i:vinte e cinco} quilômetros em Iwo Jima. Eu não me surpreenderia se {i:o} Kinzo‐san escavasse ao menos dois."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我是在海上討生活的人。挖洞的事就不清楚了。不過，在硫磺島，日軍可是挖了二十五公里的地道。那位金藏先生挖個兩公里，我是一點都不會吃驚的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我是在海上讨生活的人。挖洞的事就不清楚了。不过，在硫磺岛，日军可是挖了二十五公里的地道。那位金藏先生挖个两公里，我是一点都不会吃惊的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sono un uomo di mare. Non mi intendo di buchi. Ma l'esercito giapponese ha scavato un tunnel di 25 chilometri su Iwo Jima. Non sarei sorpreso se ‘quel’ Kinzo-san ne avesse costruito uno di 2 chilometri."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): ".........There really is something wrong with this island. Even now, not one of us really knows a thing about it."
Umineko Project (UP): ".....................This really is a strange island. Even now, not one of us really knows a thing about it."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………………やっぱり、狂った島ね。私たちはこの島のことを、未だ誰一人、何も知らない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………………やっぱり、おかしな島ね。私たちはこの島のことを、未だ誰一人、何も知らない」
Russian (RU): "............С этим островом явно что‐то нечисто. Даже сейчас никто из нас ничего толком о нём не знает."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".....................Essa é mesmo uma ilha estranha. Até agora, nenhum de nós realmente sabe nada sobre ela."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………………果然，是個瘋狂的島呢。對於這個島，我們每個人都仍一無所知。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………………果然，是个疯狂的岛呢。对于这个岛，我们每个人都仍一无所知。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... C'è davvero qualcosa di sbagliato in quest'isola. Anche ora, nessuno di noi la conosce davvero."

Steam (ST): The boat reached the shore. They would have to walk a short ways to reach the mansion.
Umineko Project (UP): The boat reached the shore. There would be a short walk to reach the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): 船が接岸する。お屋敷へは少し歩かなければならない。
Russian (RU): Катер достиг берега. Отсюда было недалеко до особняка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O barco chegou à costa. Tem um pequeno caminho a se fazer até chegar na mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 船靠了岸。要去大屋，還需稍微走點路。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 船靠了岸。要去大屋，还需稍微走点路。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La barca raggiunse la costa. Ci sarebbe stato un po' da camminare per raggiungere la villa.

Speaker: Captain Kawabata
Steam (ST): "...I'll wait here. The mansion's that way. The path from back then's probably still there, but I'll bet it's covered with plants. Make sure you don't get lost."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I'll wait here. The mansion's that way. The path from back then's probably still there, but I'll bet it's covered with plants. Make sure you don't get yourself lost."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……わしはここで待っている。屋敷は向こうだ。当時の道が残っているだろうが、草木で覆われてしまってるはずだ。迷わんように気をつけてな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……わしはここで待っている。屋敷は向こうだ。当時の道が残っているだろうが、草木で覆われてしまってるはずだ。迷わんように気をつけてな」
Russian (RU): ".....Я подожду здесь. Особняк находится там. Ведущая к нему тропинка наверняка сохранилась, но готов поспорить, что порядком заросла. Главное не потеряйтесь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu vou esperar aqui. A mansão é daquele lado. O caminho antigo ainda deve existir, mas aposto que está coberto por vegetação. Tomem cuidado para não se perderem."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……我在這裡等著。大屋就在那邊。當時的道路還留著吧，不過，應該是被草木擋住了。小心，別迷路啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……我在这里等着。大屋就在那边。当时的道路还留着吧，不过，应该是被草木挡住了。小心，别迷路啊。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Io aspetterò qui. La villa è da quella parte. Il sentiero di allora probabilmente sarà ancora lì, ma scommetto che è coperto da piante. Assicuratevi di non perdervi."

Speaker: Amakusa Juuza
Steam (ST): "Right, let's go."
Umineko Project (UP): "Right, off we go, then?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ほんじゃ、行きましょうかね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ほんじゃ、行きましょうかね」
Russian (RU): "Хорошо, идём."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Certo, vamos indo?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯，那咱們出發吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯，那咱们出发吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Giusto, andiamo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Thanks for everything, Amakusa. You wait here too."
Umineko Project (UP): "Thanks, Amakusa. But you wait here too."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ありがとう、天草。あんたもここで待ってて。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ありがとう、天草。あんたもここで待ってて」
Russian (RU): "Спасибо за всё, Амакуса. Ты тоже подожди здесь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Obrigada, Amakusa. Mas você espera aqui também."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「謝謝，天草。你也等在這兒吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「谢谢，天草。你也等在这儿吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Grazie di tutto, Amakusa. Aspetta qui anche tu."

Speaker: Amakusa Juuza
Steam (ST): "......Well, I had a feeling you'd say that."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Eh, I had a feeling you'd say that."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………まぁ、そう言い出すんじゃないかと思ってましたぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………まぁ、そう言い出すんじゃないかと思ってましたぜ」
Russian (RU): "......Что ж, я предполагал, что вы такое скажете."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Bem, eu senti que você fosse dizer isso."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………我就知道，小姐大概是會這麼說啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我就知道，小姐大概是会这么说啊。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Beh, avevo la sensazione che l'avresti detto."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "I'm just delivering something. It'll be troublesome for them if you come too. I imagine your toxin is strong."
Umineko Project (UP): "I'm just delivering something. You'll just be trouble for them if you're with me. I imagine your toxin is strong."
PC Japanese (JP): 「届け物をするだけよ。あなたが一緒だと向こうが迷惑するの。あんたの毒素、強そうだから。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「届け物をするだけよ。あなたが一緒だと向こうが迷惑するの。あんたの毒素、強そうだから」
Russian (RU): "Мне просто нужно кое‐что отнести. А твое сопровождение может привести к осложнениям. Мне думается, твой токсин очень силён."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu só estou indo entregar algo. Você só vai atrapalhar se for comigo. Suas toxinas devem ser fortes."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「只是去送下東西。你一起的話，就會令那邊的人為難了。因為，你的毒素貌似很強。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「只是去送下东西。你一起的话，就会令那边的人为难了。因为，你的毒素貌似很强。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Devo solo consegnare una cosa. Sarà un problema lì se vieni anche tu. Immagino che la tua tossina sia forte."

Speaker: Amakusa Juuza
Steam (ST): "Toxin? Oho."
Umineko Project (UP): "Toxin? Hmm."
PC Japanese (JP): 「毒素？　はて。」
Russian (RU): "Токсин? Ну‐ну."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Toxinas? Quê?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「毒素？嗯？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Tossina? Oho."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "I'll be back soon. Today, our main goal is Kuwadorian. ...After I deliver this, I'll come right back."
Umineko Project (UP): "I'll be back soon. Our main goal today is Kuwadorian. ......After I deliver this, I'll come right back."
PC Japanese (JP): 「すぐに戻るわ。今日の本命は九羽鳥庵の方だもの。……届け物をしたら、すぐに戻ってくるわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「すぐに戻るわ。今日の本命は九羽鳥庵の方だもの。……届け物をしたら、すぐに戻ってくるわ」
Russian (RU): "Скоро вернусь. Нашей основной целью сегодня является Кувадориан. ......После того, как отнесу это, сразу же вернусь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu voltarei logo. Nosso principal objetivo hoje é Kuwadorian. ......Voltarei em seguida depois disso."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「馬上就回來。畢竟，今天的主要目的是去九羽鳥庵。……等送完東西，我就馬上回來。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「马上就回来。毕竟，今天的主要目的是去九羽鸟庵。……等送完东西，我就马上回来。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Tornerò presto. Oggi, il nostro obiettivo principale è Kuwadorian. ... Dopo che porto questo, tornerò subito."

Steam (ST): Ange put on her knapsack, holding the flowers she would offer.
Umineko Project (UP): Ange put on her knapsack and grabbed the flowers she was planning to offer.
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿はナップザックを背負い、手向けの花束を持つ。
Russian (RU): Энджи надела рюкзак и взяла в руки цветы для возложения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ange largou sua mochila e pegou as flores que pretendia oferecer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緣壽背好背包，把供奉的花束拿在手中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿背好背包，把供奉的花束拿在手中。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ange si mise lo zaino, tenendo i fiori che avrebbe offerto.

Speaker: Captain Kawabata
Steam (ST): "Give her some space, young'un. ...See you soon, little lady. Your family's waiting for you."
Umineko Project (UP): "Take the hint, young'un. ......Go on, gal. Your family's waiting for you."
PC Japanese (JP): 「察してやれ、若いの。……行ってこい、お嬢ちゃん。あんたの家族が待っている。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「察してやれ、若いの。……行ってこい、お嬢ちゃん。あんたの家族が待っている」
Russian (RU): "Я сочувствую тебе, девочка. До скорого, юная леди. Твоя семья ждёт тебя."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Dê um espaço para ela, jovem. ......Vá em frente, senhorita. Sua família está esperando por você."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「體諒下吧，小伙子。……去吧，小姐。你的家人，正等著呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「体谅下吧，小伙子。……去吧，小姐。你的家人，正等着呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Capisco come si sente, giovanotta. ... A presto, signorina. La tua famiglia ti sta aspettando."

Steam (ST): I had never been on a road like this, but I had no trouble finding my way. If I walked straight ahead, it would probably guide me to the final destination for everything.
Umineko Project (UP): I had never been on a road like this, but I had no trouble finding my way.{n}If I walked straight ahead, it would probably guide me to the final destination for everything.
PC Japanese (JP): こんな道は初めてだったが、方角的に問題ない。このまま真っ直ぐ歩けば、私を全ての終着点へ導いてくれるだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): こんな道は初めてだったが、方角的に問題ない。{n}このまま真っ直ぐ歩けば、私を全ての終着点へ導いてくれるだろう。
Russian (RU): Мне ещё не доводилось ходить такой дорогой, однако у меня не возникало трудностей в поисках пути.{n}Если пойду прямо вперёд, тропа наверняка приведёт меня к заключительному пункту всего.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu nunca estive em um caminho como esse, mas também não tive problemas para me guiar.{n}Se eu seguir andando reto, a trilha provavelmente vai me guiar até ao destino final de tudo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然是頭一次走這條道，但方向上是不會有問題的。{n}只要這麼筆直走下去，它就一定會引領我去一切的終點吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然是头一次走这条道，但方向上是不会有问题的。{n}只要这么笔直走下去，它就一定会引领我去一切的终点吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non ero mai stata su un percorso così, ma non ebbi difficoltà a trovare la mia strada. Se avessi camminato dritto, probabilmente sarei arrivata all'ultima destinazione per ogni cosa.

Steam (ST): It was true that the vegetation was incredibly thick, and if I didn't pay attention, I would lose track of the path.
Umineko Project (UP): The vegetation certainly was incredible, and you would lose track of the path if you were careless enough to let your attention drift.
PC Japanese (JP): 確かに草木がものすごく、ぼんやりしているとどこが道なのかわからなくなる。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, когда растительность станет гуще, я потеряю тропу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A vegetação era certamente incrível, e você se perderia do caminho se fosse distraído o suficiente para sair da trilha por um instante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 的確，草木非常繁茂，一旦心不在焉，就會連哪裡是路都搞不明白了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 的确，草木非常繁茂，一旦心不在焉，就会连哪里是路都搞不明白了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, quando la vegetazione si faceva incredibilmente vaga, perdevo traccia del sentiero.

Steam (ST): ...But the road that was left was much clearer than I'd guessed it would be.
Umineko Project (UP): ......But the road that was left was much better than I had imagined.
PC Japanese (JP): ……でも想像していたよりは、遥かにマシな道が残されていた。
Russian (RU): Однако дорога сохранилась гораздо лучше, чем я предполагала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas o caminho que restava estava muito melhor do que eu havia imaginado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，還是留下了一條，與我想像中相比要像樣得多的道路。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，还是留下了一条，与我想象中相比要像样得多的道路。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma il percorso rimasto era molto meglio di quanto immaginassi.

Steam (ST): Still, that didn't change the fact that it was a bad road.
Umineko Project (UP): Still, that didn't change the fact that it was a bad road.
PC Japanese (JP): それでも悪路であることに変わりはない。
Russian (RU): Тем не менее, это не отменяло факта, что она пребывала в неважном состоянии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ainda assim, não mudava o fato de que era uma trilha ruim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當然，說是這麼說，難走就是難走。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当然，说是这么说，难走就是难走。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, non cambiava il fatto che non fosse un buon sentiero.

Steam (ST): ...Contrary to the distance shown on the map, I was forced to walk a long way...
Umineko Project (UP): ......Contrary to the distance shown on the map, I was forced to walk a long way......
PC Japanese (JP): ……私は地図上の距離とは裏腹に、だいぶ歩かなくてはならなかった……。
Russian (RU): В отличие от указанного на карте расстояния, мне пришлось проделать более долгий путь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ao contrário da distância mostrada no mapa, eu fui forçada a caminhar muito......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……結果，我不得不與地圖上的距離正相反地，走上了好長一段時間……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……结果，我不得不与地图上的距离正相反地，走上了好长一段时间……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Contrariamente alla distanza mostrata nella mappa, fui obbligata a camminare molto...

Steam (ST): ...The forest was deep and dark.
Umineko Project (UP): ......The forest was deep and dark.
PC Japanese (JP): ……森は深く、暗い。
Russian (RU): Лес был тёмен и дремуч.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A floresta era profunda e escura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……森林又深、又暗。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... La foresta era scura e profonda.

Steam (ST): At the time, I had been threatened into staying away from the forest because a witch lived there.
Umineko Project (UP): At the time, I had been threatened into staying away from the forest because a witch lived there.
PC Japanese (JP): 当時の私は、この森には魔女が住んでいるから近付くなと脅されていた。
Russian (RU): Когда‐то меня пугали держаться от леса подальше, потому что там жила ведьма.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquela época, eu fui ameaçada a ficar longe da floresta porque uma bruxa vivia nela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當時的我曾被嚇唬過，“這森林裡住著魔女，所以不可以靠近”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当时的我曾被吓唬过，“这森林里住着魔女，所以不可以靠近”。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Al tempo, io ero stata avvisata di stare alla larga dalla foresta con la minaccia che una strega viveva lì.

Steam (ST): Of course, that fear is gone now, ......but...I feel it.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, that fear is gone now, .........but I feel it.
PC Japanese (JP): その怯えはさすがに今はないが、………でも、感じる。
Russian (RU): Теперь, разумеется, тот страх испарился... Однако я ощущаю какую‐то крупицу его.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, esse medo já se foi, .........mas eu posso sentir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 現在再怎麼說，都不會有這份畏懼了，………但是，感覺得到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 现在再怎么说，都不会有这份畏惧了，………但是，感觉得到。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, quella paura era sparita... tuttavia, la sentivo.

Steam (ST): Because I was me, ...I could feel the presence, like an aura, of the Golden Witch, {f:5:Beatrice}...
Umineko Project (UP): Other people may not be able to, ......but I can feel the presence, like an aura, of the Golden Witch {f:5:Beatrice}...
PC Japanese (JP): 黄金の魔女、ベアトリーチェの気配、……霊気のようなもの、私だから感じることが出来る…。
Russian (RU): Поскольку я была той, кем являюсь, я чувствовала напоминающее ауру присутствие Золотой Ведьмы {f:5:Беатриче}...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Outras pessoas podem não ser capazes, ......mas eu posso sentir uma presença, como uma aura, da Bruxa Dourada {f:5:Beatrice}...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 黃金的魔女，貝阿朵莉切的氣息，……正因為是我，所以能感到這猶如靈氣之物…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 黄金的魔女，贝阿朵莉切的气息，……正因为是我，所以能感到这犹如灵气之物…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che ero io... riuscivo a sentire la presenza, come un'aura, della Strega Dorata Beatrice...

Steam (ST): Here and there were massive fallen lumps of rock along with overgrown trees and ivy. ...And the voices of birds and bugs.
Umineko Project (UP): Massive, oddly shaped rocks scattered here and there. Overgrown trees and ivy. ......The voices of birds and bugs.
PC Japanese (JP): あちこちに奇岩となって転がる巨大な岩塊と生い茂った木々と蔦。……鳥たちと虫たちの声。
Russian (RU): То тут, то там валяются громадные куски камней, да устремляются вверх высоченные деревья, обвитые плющом. .....И среди всего этого раздаются голоса птиц и насекомых.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Massivas rochas estranhamente moldadas estavam espalhadas pelos cantos. Repleto de árvores e heras. ......As vozes dos pássaros e insetos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 遍佈四周的奇形怪狀的巨大岩塊，繁茂的樹木與常春藤。……鳥與虫兒的叫聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 遍布四周的奇形怪状的巨大岩块，繁茂的树木与常春藤。……鸟与虫儿的叫声。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Qui e là vi erano enormi massi caduti assieme all'edera e agli alberi incolti. {n}e i suoni di uccelli e insetti.

Steam (ST): Yeah, I feel it. ......I feel...that the witch...is here...
Umineko Project (UP): Yeah, I can feel it. .........I can feel...that the witch...is here......
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、感じるわ。………魔女が、いるのを、感じる……。
Russian (RU): Да, я чувствую это. Я чувствую... что ведьма... здесь...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim, eu posso senti‐las. .........Eu posso sentir...que a bruxa...está aqui......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊——，感到了。………我感到了，魔女的，存在……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sì, lo sento. ... Sento... che la strega... è qui...

Steam (ST): Ahead, an ivy-covered construction site fence and warning sign stood.
Umineko Project (UP): Ahead, an ivy‐covered construction site fence and warning sign stood.
PC Japanese (JP): 前方に、蔦に絡まった工事現場の柵と警告板みたいなものが立っている。
Russian (RU): И вот впереди возник покрытый плющом строительный забор с предупреждающим знаком.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): À frente, uma cerca de campo de obras, coberta por heras e uma placa de aviso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在前方豎立著像是工地柵欄與警告牌的東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在前方竖立着像是工地栅栏与警告牌的东西。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Più avanti, c'era un cartello di avvertimento e una recinzione del sito di costruzioni coperta d'edera.

Steam (ST): "No entry, Tokyo Metropolis". That was written on it.
Umineko Project (UP): "NO ENTRY — TOKYO METROPOLIS". That was written on it.
PC Japanese (JP): “立入禁止、東京都”。そう書かれていた。
Russian (RU): "Прохода нет, столица Токио". Гласила надпись на нём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "NÃO ENTRE — METRÓPOLE DE TÓQUIO". Era o que estava escrito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 上書。“禁止入內——東京都”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 上书。“禁止入内——东京都”。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ‘Vietato l'accesso, Metropoli di Tokyo’. Questo è ciò che c'era scritto.

Steam (ST): Yeah, that's right. When you think "Tokyo", you tend to think of a city, but Rokkenjima is also located within the Tokyo Metropolis.
Umineko Project (UP): Oh, right. When you think "Tokyo", you tend to think of a city, but address‐wise, even Rokkenjima is a rightful part of Tokyo Metropolis.
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、そうか。東京というとついつい都会みたいなイメージがあるけれど、六軒島も住所上は立派な東京都だ。
Russian (RU): Да, верно. Название "Токио" тут же вызывает ассоциацию с городом, однако Роккенджима также является частью Токио.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ah, sim. Quando você pensa em "Tóquio", você tende a pensar em uma cidade, mas Rokkenjima também faz parte da Metrópole de Tóquio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊——，對了。雖然一提起東京，就不由自主地聯想到都市，但六軒島在地址上也是實實在在的東京都。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 啊——，对了。虽然一提起东京，就不由自主地联想到都市，但六轩岛在地址上也是实实在在的东京都。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Già, è vero. Quando si pensa a ‘Tokyo’, si tende a pensare ad una città, ma Rokkenjima si trova entro la Metropoli di Tokyo.

Steam (ST): ...Apologizing to the sign for my rude mistake, I climbed the fence.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Apologizing to the sign for my mistaken impression, I climbed over the fence.
PC Japanese (JP): ……失礼な誤解だったと看板に謝りながら、私は柵を越える。
Russian (RU): Извинившись перед знаком за своё ошибочное впечатление, я перелезла через забор.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Desculpando‐me com a placa por meu erro rude, eu escalei a cerca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我邊為失禮的誤解向警告牌道歉，邊翻過了柵欄。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我边为失礼的误解向警告牌道歉，边翻过了栅栏。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Scusandomi col cartello per la mia impressione sbagliata, scavalcai la recinzione.

Steam (ST): When I crossed the steep slope beyond that, ......my field of vision rapidly expanded, and a fresh sea breeze blew through my hair...
Umineko Project (UP): When I made it up the steep slope beyond that, ............my field of vision rapidly expanded, and a fresh sea breeze blew through my hair......
PC Japanese (JP): その先の急斜面を越えると、…………急に視界が開けて、鮮烈な海の風が、ざあっと私の髪を散らした……。
Russian (RU): Когда я спустилась по находящемуся за ним крутому склону... Поле моего зрения стремительно расширилось, и свежий морской бриз встрепенул мне волосы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando eu subi a íngrime ladeira além dela, ............meu campo de visão rapidamente se expandiu, e a fresca brisa do mar soprou por meus cabelos......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 爬上前方的陡坡，…………視野忽然變得開闊，鮮烈的海風呼啦吹散了我的頭髮……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 爬上前方的陡坡，…………视野忽然变得开阔，鲜烈的海风呼啦吹散了我的头发……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando attraversai il ripido pendio dietro di essa... il mio campo visivo si espanse rapidamente, e una frasca brezza marina mi soffiò attraverso i capelli...

Steam (ST): It was like the top of a little hill.
Umineko Project (UP): It was like the top of a little hill.
PC Japanese (JP): そこはさながら、ちょっとした丘の上だった。
Russian (RU): Похоже, это была вершина маленького холма.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era como o topo de uma pequena colina.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此處貌似是在一個小小的山丘之上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此处貌似是在一个小小的山丘之上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Fu come in cima ad una piccola collina.

Steam (ST): ...Below me was a vast view of the island.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Below me was a vast view of the island.
PC Japanese (JP): ……眼下には、島の広大な眺望が。
Russian (RU): Внизу подо мной находилась обширная панорама острова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Abaixo de mim estava uma vasta vista da ilha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……雖然盡收眼底的島的廣大景色。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……虽然尽收眼底的岛的广大景色。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Sotto di me c'era l'ampia veduta dell'isola.

Steam (ST): I could only see desolated forest and rock walls spread out below me. ...But I realized that the mansion was probably somewhere around there.
Umineko Project (UP): I could only see desolated forest and rocky crags spread out below me. ......But, somehow, I realized that the mansion was probably somewhere around there.
PC Japanese (JP): 私には荒れ果てた森と岩場が広がっているようにしか見えない。……でも、何となく、あの辺りが屋敷だろうと察しが付いた。
Russian (RU): Но видела я лишь раскинувшиеся подо мной дикий лес и каменные стены. Однако каким‐то образом я осознала, что особняк находился где‐то там внизу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu só conseguia ver a floresta desolada e penhascos rochosos se estendendo abaixo de mim. ......Mas, de alguma forma, eu percebi que a mansão provavelmente estava em algum lugar próximo dali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在我眼中，僅僅是荒涼的森林與一大片岩灘。……不過，我多多少少感到了，大屋就在那邊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在我眼中，仅仅是荒凉的森林与一大片岩滩。……不过，我多多少少感到了，大屋就在那边。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Potei solamente vedere desolate foreste e pareti rocciose allargarsi al di sotto di me. ... Ma, in qualche modo, capii che la villa era probabilmente da qualche parte lì intorno.

Steam (ST): The steep downward slope beyond this hill had probably been caused by earth and rocks collapsing from 12 years of wind and rain.
Umineko Project (UP): The steep downward slope beyond this hill had probably been caused by landslides from twelve years of wind and rain.
PC Japanese (JP): その丘からの急な下り坂は、１２年間の風雨で土砂が崩れてしまったのかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Крутой склон за этим холмом наверняка возник в результате лавин от ветра с дождём на протяжении 12 лет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A ingrime descida além da colina provavelmente foi causada por deslizamentos de terra ocasionados devido aos 12 anos de vento e chuva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從這山丘下去的下坡路，也許是因十二年間的風雨而坍塌了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从这山丘下去的下坡路，也许是因十二年间的风雨而坍塌了吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I pendii ripidi verso il basso oltre questa collina probabilmente erano stati causati da frane in 12 anni di vento e pioggia.

Steam (ST): It had become a slant filled with crags that you might even call gentle cliffs, and it would be easy to tumble down, though it looked like climbing back would be pretty difficult.
Umineko Project (UP): It had become a slant filled with crags that you might even call gentle cliffs, and though it would be easy to tumble down, it looked like climbing back would be pretty difficult.
PC Japanese (JP): 緩やかな崖といってもいいような岩だらけの斜面になっており、転げ落ちるのは簡単だが、登るのはかなり難しくなっているようだった。
Russian (RU): Итак, передо мной находился склон, усеянный выступами, которые можно было назвать небольшими утёсами, а сам спуск обещал быть лёгким, тогда как обратный подъём — невероятно тяжёлой затеей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia se transformado em uma inclinação repleta de penhascos que você até poderia chamar de gentis falésias e, embora fosse fácil de tropeçar, parece que subir seria bem difícil.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 變成了稱之為較緩的懸崖都行的，遍佈岩石的斜面，雖然要滾下去是挺容易的，但要爬上來就難如登天了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 变成了称之为较缓的悬崖都行的，遍布岩石的斜面，虽然要滚下去是挺容易的，但要爬上来就难如登天了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era diventato un pendio con falesie che si potrebbero persino definire lievi rupi, e sarebbe facile cadere, anche se sembra parecchio difficile da scalare.

Steam (ST): ......In any event, it seemed that proceeding any further would be impossible.
Umineko Project (UP): .........It seemed that proceeding any further would be impossible.
PC Japanese (JP): ………どうやら、これ以上を進むのは、無理なようだった。
Russian (RU): В любом случае, дальнейшее продвижение выглядело невозможным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Parece que avançar mais seria impossível.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………看來，已經沒法繼續前進了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………看来，已经没法继续前进了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ad ogni modo, sembra che procedere ulteriormente sia impossibile.

Steam (ST): If I continued any further, I wouldn't be able to return. In other words, ......this is...the border.
Umineko Project (UP): If I continued any further, I wouldn't be able to return.{n}In other words, .........this is...the border.
PC Japanese (JP): これ以上を進めば、戻れなくなる。つまりは、………ここが、境。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): これ以上を進めば、戻れなくなる。{n}つまりは、………ここが、境。
Russian (RU): Продолжи я идти дальше — и вернуться уже не смогу.{n}Другими словами... это граница.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se eu continuar indo além, não serei capaz de voltar.{n}Em outras palavras, .........esta é...a divisa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如要再往前走，就沒法回來了。{n}也就是說，………此處即是分界線。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如要再往前走，就没法回来了。{n}也就是说，………此处即是分界线。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se continuassi più in là, non riuscirei a tornare. In altre parole... questo è... il confine.

Steam (ST): This place is 1986 and 1998. And, it is that day and today. The boundary between this world and nirvana.
Umineko Project (UP): Between 1986 and 1998. That day and today.{n}And this world and the other.
PC Japanese (JP): ここが１９８６年と１９９８年。そして、あの日と今日。彼岸と此岸の、境目。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ここが１９８６年と１９９８年。そして、あの日と今日。{n}彼岸と此岸の、境目。
Russian (RU): Это место является 1986‐м и 1998‐м. И сегодня как раз этот день.{n}Граница между этим миром и нирваной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entre 1986 e 1998. Aquele dia e o dia de hoje.{n}A fronteira entre este mundo e o nirvana.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此處即是 1986 年與 1998 年。那天與今天。{n}彼岸與此岸的，分界線。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此处即是 1986 年与 1998 年。那天与今天。{n}彼岸与此岸的，分界线。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo posto è 1986 e 1998. Ed è quel giorno e il giorno d'oggi. Il confine tra questo mondo è il nirvana.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "......This spot is... this journey's final destination, it seems."
Umineko Project (UP): "............This is......this journey's...final destination, it seems."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………ここが、……この旅の、終着点みたいね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………ここが、……この旅の、終着点みたいね」
Russian (RU): ".......Это место, по‐видимому, является заключительной точкой данного путешествия."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Este ponto......é o destino final...da jornada."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………看來，……此處即是，這趟旅途的終點呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………看来，……此处即是，这趟旅途的终点呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Questo posto è... la destinazione finale di questo viaggio, sembra."

Steam (ST): As the strong winds blew Mammon's and Sakutaro's hair, they looked down from the hilltop...
Umineko Project (UP): As the strong wind blew Mammon and Sakutaro's hair, they looked down from the hilltop...
PC Japanese (JP): マモンもさくたろも、強い風に髪を散らしながら、丘から眼下を見下ろしている…。
Russian (RU): Ветер всколыхнул волосы Мамоны и Сакутаро, взглянувших вниз с вершины холма.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com o forte vento soprando nos cabelos de Mammon e Sakutaro, eles olharam para baixo, do topo da colina...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 馬蒙與櫻太郎也邊被強風吹散頭髮，邊在山丘上俯瞰下方…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 马蒙与樱太郎也边被强风吹散头发，边在山丘上俯瞰下方…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Come il forte vento soffiava tra i capelli di Mammon e Sakutarou, loro guardarono giù dalla cima della collina...

Speaker: Mammon
Steam (ST): "...From here, I can't really tell. Where's the mansion? Let's get closer."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I can't make out a thing from here. Where's the mansion? Let's get closer."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……ここからじゃ、さっぱりわからないわ。お屋敷はどこ？　もっと近付きましょうよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……ここからじゃ、さっぱりわからないわ。お屋敷はどこ？　もっと近付きましょうよ」

Umineko Project (UP): He's right. ......This is 1998, ......and I am the Ushiromiya Ange who has been left all alone.

Steam (ST): At first, this was a journey to die. But not anymore. It's become a journey to accomplish something...
Umineko Project (UP): At first, it was a journey to die. But not anymore.{n}It has become a journey to accomplish something......

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Yeah. ...So, I'm sorry, you two. Although, as I was back then on that day, I would've gone down that cliff without any hesitation."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yeah. ......So, I'm sorry, you two. As I was back then, on that day, I would have gone down this cliff without any hesitation."
PC Japanese (JP): 「うん。……だからごめんね、二人とも。あの日の私なら、何も躊躇わずにこの崖を降りるだろうけれど。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うん。……だからごめんね、二人とも。あの日の私なら、何も戸惑わずにこの崖を降りるだろうけれど」
Russian (RU): "Ага. .....Мамона, Сакутаро, вы уж простите меня. Будь я такой, какой была в прошлом, то, не колеблясь, стала бы спускаться вниз."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. ......Por isso eu peço desculpas a vocês. Como eu era antes, naquele dia, eu teria descido essa falésia sem qualquer hesitação."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯。……所以，抱歉，兩位。若是那一天的我的話，就會毫不猶豫地從這懸崖上跳下去了吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯。……所以，抱歉，两位。若是那一天的我的话，就会毫不犹豫地从这悬崖上跳下去了吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Già. ... Quindi, mi spiace per voi due. Tuttavia, se fossi quella di quel giorno, sarei scesa da quella rupe senza nessuna esitazione."

Umineko Project (UP): "Come on, this is pretty lame for the skyscraper‐jumping Ushiromiya Ange."

Umineko Project (UP): "Sorry."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「对不起。」

Umineko Project (UP): Sakutaro said it as though it was completely natural.{n}......And...I believed it.

Umineko Project (UP): Mom. Dad. Onii‐chan.{n}All of my relatives, and those fun servants.{n}And............Maria onee‐chan.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): お父さん。お母さん。お兄ちゃん。{n}親族のみんなに、楽しい使用人の人たち。{n}そして、…………真里亞お姉ちゃん。

Umineko Project (UP): "It's me. ......It's Ange. ...............I've...come back."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私よ。……縁寿よ。……………私は、帰ってきたわ」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是我哟。……缘寿哟。……………我，回来了。」
